<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID-19
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021-holiday-covid-surge-omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Hello Covid My Old Friend
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021-holiday-covid-surge-omicron?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="stop signal with a coronavirus theme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-0db180fb893edbbc4d8ac31c5ecfc124149dbe71-1500x1000-gif/stop_and_go.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="stop signal with a coronavirus theme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-10-26/image-0db180fb893edbbc4d8ac31c5ecfc124149dbe71-1500x1000-gif/stop_and_go.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You may not be able to watch your boss drink three liters of spiked eggnog and attempt the Whole Shack Shimmy this year after all. Omicron is here and, in a tag team with Delta, is forcing corporate America to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-16/-i-was-wrong-omicron-wrecks-ceos-plans-for-u-s-office-return?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pivot hard</a> on holiday parties, WFH policies, and in-person events.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to Johns Hopkins University, Covid cases across the US are up 40% from last month to an average of 118,717 new daily cases. NYC is a major hotspot: Positivity rates doubled in just three days from December 9–12, something that's never happened in NYC before in the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The latest Covid surge is causing major problems for reopened America, just in time for the holidays.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Goldman Sachs and other companies are canceling upcoming holiday parties.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In Washington, the White House said it will dramatically scale back festivities this year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The association of HR professionals received more than 500 inquiries about Omicron over Thanksgiving break, according to WSJ.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like a September Delta rerun, plans to head back to IRL work have stalled, or have been scrapped entirely in some cases. On Wednesday, Apple indefinitely delayed its return to the office, naming Omicron specifically as the cause. Google, Uber, Lyft, and Ford have also pushed back plans.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Indoor may be going out the door</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In-person entertainment like concerts, Broadway shows, and sporting events are also being affected during the critical holiday season.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some large concerts for acts like Dead & Company and The Eagles have seen no-show rates as high as 20%, per the WSJ.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Broadway shows like </span><span><em>Hamilton</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>Mrs. Doubtfire</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>Harry Potter and The Cursed Child</em></span><span>, and several others have had to cancel performances in recent days due to Covid breakthroughs among casts and crews.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly 100 NFL players tested positive for Covid between Monday and Wednesday this week.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>studies indicate that boosters can restore protection against the Omicron variant. This week, booster mandates from businesses and colleges began to spring up across the country and will likely continue to expand.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/16/spider-man-no-way-home-could-be-the-first-pandemic-era-movie-to-break-usd100-million-opening-weekend-mark?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Tom Holland Needs to Save More Than Just New York
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/16/spider-man-no-way-home-could-be-the-first-pandemic-era-movie-to-break-usd100-million-opening-weekend-mark?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Theater illustration with spider web over it" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3f4dfc5ea592cbe17a4c8f78032abb72b767cc28-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><em>Francis Scialabba, gizmo/Getty</em></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After <em>West Side Story</em>’s disappointing opening weekend last week, movie theaters are hoping Tom Holland swinging around NYC for 2.5 hours will be the Hail Mary they need. <em>Spider-Man: No Way Home</em>, which hits theaters today, is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/14/spider-man-no-way-home-heads-for-highest-pandemic-box-office-opening.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected</a> to be the first Covid-era movie to break the $100 million mark on opening weekend ticket sales.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Analysts are expecting the new Spider-Man flick to bring in anywhere from $130 million to (optimistically) $200 million. Pre-Covid, theatrical releases routinely smashed (or at least got close to) $100 million in their opening weekends, especially for movies with everyone’s favorite neighborhood arachnid boy: In 2017, <em>Spider-Man: Homecoming</em> brought in $117 million and its sequel in 2019, <em>Spider-Man: Far From Home</em>, just barely missed the mark with $92 million.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Right now, </span><span><em>Venom: Let There Be Carnage</em></span><span> holds the record for the biggest opening weekend during the Covid-19 era at $90 million.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Early indications look promising.</strong> Thanks to its long list of confirmed—and rumored—cameos, the film already set pandemic-era opening day records in overseas markets like Korea ($5.28 million), Mexico ($9 million), and the UK ($10.1 million) on Wednesday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Get pumped:</strong> Here’s a spoiler-free <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1471166737584631817?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">review</a> of <em>Spider-Man: No Way Home</em>.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/16/turkey-cuts-interest-rates-hikes-the-minimum-wage-in-its-losing-battle-against-a-currency-crisis?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Turkey Shows How <em>Not </em>to Battle Inflation
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/16/turkey-cuts-interest-rates-hikes-the-minimum-wage-in-its-losing-battle-against-a-currency-crisis?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="urkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan speaks to announce the net minimum wage will be raised by 50 percent starting next yea" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/df77afdcfdd8cd7092581ea83e5e2683fe76a197-1024x716.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, ADEM ALTAN/AFP via Getty Image</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You think inflation is bad here in the US? Let’s take a trip to Turkey, where inflation hit 21% in November and its currency, the lira, has shed 40% of its value against the dollar in the last three months.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These twin crises are eroding the ability of Turks to pay for everyday necessities like food, energy, and medicine. Lines are forming to buy bread. Youth unemployment is at 25%. One electrician <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/15/world/europe/turkey-bread-prices.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the NYT</a> that his rent just went up to 2,000 lira; he makes 2,900 lira a month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s been the response from the government? </strong>Pretty disastrous. As we know from the US’ current predicament, central banks typically raise interest rates in order to tamp down inflation. But Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, who essentially controls the country’s economic policy, believes that it’s better to <em>lower </em>interest rates in the face of spiraling inflation, compounding the problem and spooking investors around the globe.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest: </strong>Turkey’s central bank cut interest rates again yesterday, and Erdoğan announced a 50% increase in the minimum wage. Experts say these actions will only exacerbate the currency crisis and stoke more inflation.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Removing yourself from the pillowy oasis known as “your bed” can be the most challenging feat of a given day. Some days, our alarms feel like our own personal tormentors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So let’s get up better. This newsletter’s dad, Morning Brew cofounder and executive chairman Alex Lieberman, will show you how. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N351805.3407870MORNINGBREW/B26684446.317722085;dc_trk_aid=511225612;dc_trk_cid=101769758;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this article</a>, created in partnership with Braun, Alex shares his secrets to doing 7,000 burpees and developing a rock-solid morning routine. A sneak peek to whet your appetite: it involves hanging with his adorable pup Rambo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Believe it or not, it gets even better from there, but you’ve gotta <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N351805.3407870MORNINGBREW/B26684446.317722085;dc_trk_aid=511225612;dc_trk_cid=101769758;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read the article</a> to find out what comes after the adorable pup-hang. And if it inspires a world-changing idea, like, oh, we don’t know, a business newsletter that’s fun to read, you’ll have us to thank. </p>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/16/key-performance-indicators-december-17?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Jay-Z" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/b1ba25f4b639bcc581b8a2a51d226e9aa1e83ff8-4928x3280.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Axelle/Bauer-Griffin/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Jay-Z has 99 problems and his SPAC is definitely one. Shares of the SPAC tied to the music mogul were <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-16/celebrity-spacs-leave-famous-winners-looking-more-like-losers?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">down 84%</a> this year as of Dec. 13, the worst performance of all 33 SPACs linked to celebrities. Fellow A-listers who tried to cash in on the SPAC boom aren’t exactly crushing it, either: 21 out of the 33 celebrity SPACs are negative for the year, per Bloomberg.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I was wrong on this.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/13/morgan-stanley-ceo-says-he-was-wrong-on-return-to-office-push.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walked back</a> comments he made in June that he’d be “very disappointed” if the bank’s employees didn’t come back to the office by Labor Day. “Everybody’s still finding their way” when it comes to Covid, he told CNBC this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>An interview with Kim Kardashian. (<a href="https://bariweiss.substack.com/p/my-conversation-with-kim-kardashian?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Common Sense</a>)</p>
</div>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou may not be able to watch your boss drink three liters of spiked eggnog and attempt the Whole Shack Shimmy this year after all. Omicron is here and, in a tag team with Delta, is forcing corporate America to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-16/-i-was-wrong-omicron-wrecks-ceos-plans-for-u-s-office-return?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epivot hard\u003c/a\u003e on holiday parties, WFH policies, and in-person events.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to Johns Hopkins University, Covid cases across the US are up 40% from last month to an average of 118,717 new daily cases. NYC is a major hotspot: Positivity rates doubled in just three days from December 9–12, something that's never happened in NYC before in the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe latest Covid surge is causing major problems for reopened America, just in time for the holidays.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoldman Sachs and other companies are canceling upcoming holiday parties.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn Washington, the White House said it will dramatically scale back festivities this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe association of HR professionals received more than 500 inquiries about Omicron over Thanksgiving break, according to WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike a September Delta rerun, plans to head back to IRL work have stalled, or have been scrapped entirely in some cases. On Wednesday, Apple indefinitely delayed its return to the office, naming Omicron specifically as the cause. Google, Uber, Lyft, and Ford have also pushed back plans.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIndoor may be going out the door\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn-person entertainment like concerts, Broadway shows, and sporting events are also being affected during the critical holiday season.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome large concerts for acts like Dead \u0026 Company and The Eagles have seen no-show rates as high as 20%, per the WSJ.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBroadway shows like \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHamilton\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMrs. Doubtfire\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHarry Potter and The Cursed Child\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and several others have had to cancel performances in recent days due to Covid breakthroughs among casts and crews.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly 100 NFL players tested positive for Covid between Monday and Wednesday this week.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003estudies indicate that boosters can restore protection against the Omicron variant. This week, booster mandates from businesses and colleges began to spring up across the country and will likely continue to href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/14/spider-man-no-way-home-heads-for-highest-pandemic-box-office-opening.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" opening weekend ticket sales.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnalysts are expecting the new Spider-Man flick to bring in anywhere from $130 million to (optimistically) $200 million. Pre-Covid, theatrical releases routinely smashed (or at least got close to) $100 million in their opening weekends, especially for movies with everyone’s favorite neighborhood arachnid boy: In 2017, \u003cem\u003eSpider-Man: Homecoming\u003c/em\u003e brought in $117 million and its sequel in 2019, \u003cem\u003eSpider-Man: Far From Home\u003c/em\u003e, just barely missed the mark with $92 million.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRight now, $90 million.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEarly indications look promising.\u003c/strong\u003e Thanks to its long list of confirmed—and rumored—cameos, the film already set pandemic-era opening day records in overseas markets like Korea ($5.28 million), Mexico ($9 million), and the UK ($10.1 million) on Wednesday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGet Image\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou think inflation is bad here in the US? Let’s take a trip to Turkey, where inflation hit 21% in November and its currency, the lira, has shed 40% of its value against the dollar in the last three months.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese twin crises are eroding the ability of Turks to pay for everyday necessities like food, energy, and medicine. Lines are forming to buy bread. Youth unemployment is at 25%. One electrician \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/12/15/world/europe/turkey-bread-prices.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the NYT\u003c/a\u003e that his rent just went up to 2,000 lira; he makes 2,900 lira a month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s been the response from the government? \u003c/strong\u003ePretty disastrous. As we know from the US’ current predicament, central banks typically raise interest rates in order to tamp down inflation. But Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, who essentially controls the country’s economic policy, believes that it’s better to \u003cem\u003elower \u003c/em\u003einterest rates in the face of spiraling inflation, compounding the problem and spooking investors around the globe.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest: \u003c/strong\u003eTurkey’s central bank cut interest rates again yesterday, and Erdoğan announced a 50% increase in the minimum wage. Experts say these actions will only exacerbate the currency crisis and stoke more inflation.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
